intro: Acineta alticola, commonly known as the mountain acineta, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in the Andean regions of countries like Bolivia and Peru. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants such as carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its botanical features include a compact growth habit, finely divided leaves, and white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Acineta alticola is considered a rare and specialized species.
